column4: does anyone know anything about ssh keys? I'm following the howto on the wiki, and at one stage it says "Add an SSH call to your crontab and you are set." Does anyone know HOW to do this? thanks in advance
what do you want to do whith ssh keys ?
i want to use them to authenticate over ssh, and also to make a key to automate backups over ssh
you can re-use a existing ssh agent with it
right but I still need to set up crontab properly don't i?
for me no ... i just enter my password at boot and it's done
each time i ssh on a remote server, i dont have to enter my password
beacause i put my public key on each if them
does your ssh key have a passphrase?
yes, in fact, when i said password, it was passphrase
so there is a daemon remembering and entering your passphrase automatically?
if you want, we can make it step by step
no i think i'd rather have separate keys
